Original: Codenamed Puma by Inner Sphere forces who first engaged it, the Adder is a light Clan OmniMech that serves as a direct or an indirect fire-support unit in most of its configurations.The Primary configuration has a basic but powerful arsenal of two ER PPCs which are linked to an advanced Targeting Computer, allowing the Primary configuration of the Adder to strike at long range with deadly accuracy, this is alongside the standard flamer. Restricted Actuators- Omni
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_adder_ADR-Prime.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: Codenamed Puma by Inner Sphere forces who first engaged it, the Adder is a light Clan OmniMech that serves as a direct or an indirect fire-support unit in most of its configurations.The Primary configuration has a basic but powerful arsenal of two ER PPCs which are linked to an advanced Targeting Computer, allowing the Primary configuration of the Adder to strike at long range with deadly accuracy, this is alongside the standard flamer. Restricted Actuators- Omni

Original: The Albatross was designed by the Free Worlds League in 3053 with an eye toward a possible future conflict with the then advancing Clans. The 'Mech is built using a Hermes 380 XL Engine to minimize weight and maximize free tonnage for its weapon loadout. The Albatross also uses a variety of weapons in an attempt to make the 'Mech effective at any range. The 'Mech has average mobility with a maximum speed of 64.8 kph and also makes use of double heat sinks for their greater heat dissipation capability. Restricted Actuators- Left: Lower, Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_albatross_ALB-3U.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The Albatross was designed by the Free Worlds League in 3053 with an eye toward a possible future conflict with the then advancing Clans. The 'Mech is built using a Hermes 380 XL Engine to minimize weight and maximize free tonnage for its weapon loadout. The Albatross also uses a variety of weapons in an attempt to make the 'Mech effective at any range. The 'Mech has average mobility with a maximum speed of 64.8 kph and also makes use of double heat sinks for their greater heat dissipation capability. Restricted Actuators- Left: Lower, Right: Lower

Original: Originally developed in the final year of the Amaris Civil War as the ultimate fixed position city defense BattleMech, the Annihilator was built as a sign of the military strength of the Star League in Exile. The -1A was armed with four Autocannon/10s and four Medium Lasers. While less accurate than the original -2A, the 1A was still a highly destructive and dangerous 'Mech that no MechWarrior looked forward to engaging. Restricted Actuators- Left: Lower, Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_annihilator_ANH-1A.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: Originally developed in the final year of the Amaris Civil War as the ultimate fixed position city defense BattleMech, the Annihilator was built as a sign of the military strength of the Star League in Exile. The -1A was armed with four Autocannon/10s and four Medium Lasers. While less accurate than the original -2A, the 1A was still a highly destructive and dangerous 'Mech that no MechWarrior looked forward to engaging. Restricted Actuators- Left: Lower, Right: Lower

Original: Still a fearsome and powerful design, where the original Annihilator-1A carries a bevy of powerful autocannons, the -1E instead opts for an all-energy weapon loadout. Four Particle Projection Cannons give the Annihilator-1E a brutal and incredibly powerful punch while the Medium Lasers from the -1A are carried over for in-close protection while increasing the armor protection somewhat to mitigate enemy return fire. Restricted Actuators- Left: Lower, Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_annihilator_ANH-1E.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: Still a fearsome and powerful design, where the original Annihilator-1A carries a bevy of powerful autocannons, the -1E instead opts for an all-energy weapon loadout. Four Particle Projection Cannons give the Annihilator-1E a brutal and incredibly powerful punch while the Medium Lasers from the -1A are carried over for in-close protection while increasing the armor protection somewhat to mitigate enemy return fire. Restricted Actuators- Left: Lower, Right: Lower

Original: The Apollo is designed to be a long range fire support BattleMech. This is accomplished by mounting an engine on the 'Mech that gives it a top speed of only 64.8 kph and eleven and a half tons of armor. The 'Mech was then armed with massive missile launchers which can rain destruction down on an enemy. While the Apollo has less than average speed for a medium 'Mech, if it is employed correctly the Apollo should have nothing to fear from enemy fire; it is fully capable of staying at the edge of the battlefield and laying down suppressive LRM fire.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_apollo_APL-1M.Details

Original: The Arctic Fox is a light OmniMech reverse engineered by the Kell Hounds from the Clan Uller OmniMech with assistance in the final stages from Clan Wolf-in-Exile. The resulting OmniMech is a powerful light 'Mech that has a top speed of 97.2 km/h that is provided by a GM 180 XL engine, shaving off valuable weight from the Arctic Fox's base chassis while also making the 'Mech vulnerable to becoming a combat kill through the loss of one of its side torsos. The Arctic Fox has ten double heat sinks which are generally enough to handle the 'Mech's heat load, with the ability to add more if needed. To protect itself from enemy fire, the Arctic Fox has six tons of Royal-7 armor. Restricted Actuators- Omni
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_arcticfox_AF1.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The Arctic Fox is a light OmniMech reverse engineered by the Kell Hounds from the Clan Uller OmniMech with assistance in the final stages from Clan Wolf-in-Exile. The resulting OmniMech is a powerful light 'Mech that has a top speed of 97.2 km/h that is provided by a GM 180 XL engine, shaving off valuable weight from the Arctic Fox's base chassis while also making the 'Mech vulnerable to becoming a combat kill through the loss of one of its side torsos. The Arctic Fox has ten double heat sinks which are generally enough to handle the 'Mech's heat load, with the ability to add more if needed. To protect itself from enemy fire, the Arctic Fox has six tons of Royal-7 armor. Restricted Actuators- Omni

Original: Keeping the top speed of the ASN-21 as well as its base weapon load of missiles, the ASN-101 is a rare Federated Suns variant that drops two jump jets and a half ton of armor to mount a trio of Small Lasers, giving the ASN-101 a much better close-in punch compared to its progenitor. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_assassin_ASN-101.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: Keeping the top speed of the ASN-21 as well as its base weapon load of missiles, the ASN-101 is a rare Federated Suns variant that drops two jump jets and a half ton of armor to mount a trio of Small Lasers, giving the ASN-101 a much better close-in punch compared to its progenitor. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower

Original: Assassin was designed to complete against the lighter scout mechs like the Wasp and Stinger but is twice as heavy, faster, greater jump range, heavier armor and much more firepower. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_assassin_ASN-21.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: Assassin was designed to complete against the lighter scout mechs like the Wasp and Stinger but is twice as heavy, faster, greater jump range, heavier armor and much more firepower. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower

Original: The -23 variant of the Assassin is an upgrade of the original model using Lostech; originally seen as a standardized field modification, in 3067 new production began at Hellespont 'Mech Works. The SRM-2 has been removed to upgrade the Medium Laser to a Medium Pulse Laser and an Artemis IV fire control system has been added for the LRM-5 launcher. Within the CCAF, TDF and MAF it is largely used as a cheap way to rebuild shattered forces and sees service mostly in green and reserve formations. The Capellans in particular use the -23 as a fire-support unit for pursuit and strike lances, though shortages of Artemis munitions means many are forced to use mine-delivery missiles. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_assassin_ASN-23.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The -23 variant of the Assassin is an upgrade of the original model using Lostech; originally seen as a standardized field modification, in 3067 new production began at Hellespont 'Mech Works. The SRM-2 has been removed to upgrade the Medium Laser to a Medium Pulse Laser and an Artemis IV fire control system has been added for the LRM-5 launcher. Original: First fielded in 2765, the Atlas II was designed by the Hegemony Research and Development Department, Weapons Division of the original Star League to maintain the technological edge over the other Great Houses. It was exclusively for the SLDF's Royal Regiments. In 2785, when General Aleksandr Kerensky put out his call for loyal forces to join him in his Exodus, every Atlas II pilot responded and left with him. The Atlas II is armed with an array of weaponry, including an LB-X Autocannon/10, a pair of ER Large Lasers, and a 20-tube Long Range Missile Launcher for long range attacks. For close range combat, the 'Mech is equipped with a pair of Medium Pulse Lasers and a Holly Six Pack. In addition, the 'Mech has been given CASEfor both sides of the torso in order to keep an ammunition cook-off from consuming the 'Mech.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_atlasii_AS7-D-H.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: First fielded in 2765, the Atlas II was designed by the Hegemony Research and Development Department, Weapons Division of the original Star League to maintain the technological edge over the other Great Houses. It was exclusively for the SLDF's Royal Regiments. In 2785, when General Aleksandr Kerensky put out his call for loyal forces to join him in his Exodus, every Atlas II pilot responded and left with him. The Atlas II is armed with an array of weaponry, including an LB-X Autocannon/10, a pair of ER Large Lasers, and a 20-tube Long Range Missile Launcher for long range attacks. For close range combat, the 'Mech is equipped with a pair of Medium Pulse Lasers and a Holly Six Pack. In addition, the 'Mech has been given CASEfor both sides of the torso in order to keep an ammunition cook-off from consuming the 'Mech.

Original: This variant of the Atlas II exchanges both ER Large Lasers and its LB 10-X for a Kinslaughter ER PPC and a Gauss Rifle while removing only one double heat sink
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_atlasii_AS7-D-H2.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: This variant of the Atlas II exchanges both ER Large Lasers and its LB 10-X for a Kinslaughter ER PPC and a Gauss Rifle while removing only one double heat sink

Original: The Atlas A is the first try to be the king of the battlefield, capable of bringing a dizzying array of weapons to bear on targets at any range. It is also noteworthy for normally mounting the maximum amount of armor possible. Few opponents can survive even brief contact with this monster.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_atlas_AS7-A.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The Atlas A is the first try to be the king of the battlefield, capable of bringing a dizzying array of weapons to bear on targets at any range. It is also noteworthy for normally mounting the maximum amount of armor possible. Few opponents can survive even brief contact with this monster.

Original: Built in 2776, this Atlas variant is the largest 'Mech equipped with a Command Console. To free up the weight required to fit this device, the AS7-D-DC removes one ton of LRM ammunition and the paired rear firing lasers. Effective at Close and Long Range Fire Support. Recommended for use by Experienced Tactical Commanders. Extremely Rare and largely Extinct.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_atlas_AS7-D-DC.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: Built in 2776, this Atlas variant is the largest 'Mech equipped with a Command Console. To free up the weight required to fit this device, the AS7-D-DC removes one ton of LRM ammunition and the paired rear firing lasers. Effective at Close and Long Range Fire Support. Recommended for use by Experienced Tactical Commanders. Extremely Rare and largely Extinct.

Original: Known as the 'Atlas II,' the D-HT model carries more Energy weaponry and usually a lighter, more flexible Autocannon. It still has unbelievable protection and the same crushing Melee ability as other Atlas models.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_atlas_AS7-D-HT.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: Known as the 'Atlas II,' the D-HT model carries more Energy weaponry and usually a lighter, more flexible Autocannon. It still has unbelievable protection and the same crushing Melee ability as other Atlas models.

Original: The Atlas D is the king of the battlefield, capable of bringing a dizzying array of weapons to bear on targets at any range. It is also noteworthy for normally mounting the maximum amount of armor possible. Few opponents can survive even brief contact with this monster.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_atlas_AS7-D.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The Atlas D is the king of the battlefield, capable of bringing a dizzying array of weapons to bear on targets at any range. It is also noteworthy for normally mounting the maximum amount of armor possible. Few opponents can survive even brief contact with this monster.

Original: A Combine upgrade of the Atlas that used rediscovered Star League technology, the K model was built with a Vlar 300 XL Engine. Carrying a Shigunga LRM-20 with two tons of ammo in the left torso the 'Mech was rearmed for long range combat with an Imperator Dragon's Fire Gauss Rifle in place of the autocannon, with two tons of gauss rounds carried in the right arm, backed up by a pair of Victory Nickel Alloy ER Large Lasers split between both arms. This armament allowed the AS7-K to keep an enemy at range, though the continued use of twenty single heat sinks caused swift heat buildup if both lasers are fired repeatedly. For close range defense, the K model carried two Victory Heartbeat Medium Pulse Lasers and a Yori Flyswatter Anti-Missile System in the left arm. To round off the AS7-K's defense, CASE was added to the side torsos to protect against an ammunition explosion.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_atlas_AS7-K.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: A Combine upgrade of the Atlas that used rediscovered Star League technology, the K model was built with a Vlar 300 XL Engine. Carrying a Shigunga LRM-20 with two tons of ammo in the left torso the 'Mech was rearmed for long range combat with an Imperator Dragon's Fire Gauss Rifle in place of the autocannon, with two tons of gauss rounds carried in the right arm, backed up by a pair of Victory Nickel Alloy ER Large Lasers split between both arms. This armament allowed the AS7-K to keep an enemy at range, though the continued use of twenty single heat sinks caused swift heat buildup if both lasers are fired repeatedly. For close range defense, the K model carried two Victory Heartbeat Medium Pulse Lasers and a Yori Flyswatter Anti-Missile System in the left arm. To round off the AS7-K's defense, CASE was added to the side torsos to protect against an ammunition explosion.

Original: A Succession Wars era attempt at recreating the Atlas II's loadout, the AS7-RS downgrades the AutoCannon, LRMs and SRMs while trading out the Medium Lasers for a pair of arm mounted Large Lasers.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_atlas_AS7-RS.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: A Succession Wars era attempt at recreating the Atlas II's loadout, the AS7-RS downgrades the AutoCannon, LRMs and SRMs while trading out the Medium Lasers for a pair of arm mounted Large Lasers.

Original: The first of the Inner Sphere OmniMechs to be conceptualized and one of the last to reach production by the Draconis Combine, the Avatar's design is based on captured Vulture OmniMechs. Restricted Actuators- Omni
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_avatar_AV1-O.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The first of the Inner Sphere OmniMechs to be conceptualized and one of the last to reach production by the Draconis Combine, the Avatar's design is based on captured Vulture OmniMechs. Restricted Actuators- Omni

Original: Focused on close combat, the A configuration carries an ER Large Laser as its only long range weapon. Mounting a pair of SRM-6 launchers, an Autocannon/20 and the two Medium Lasers mounted on the base chassis, the Avatar A is a fearsome opponent with devastating close range punch. Restricted Actuators- Omni
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_avatar_AV1-OA.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: Focused on close combat, the A configuration carries an ER Large Laser as its only long range weapon. Mounting a pair of SRM-6 launchers, an Autocannon/20 and the two Medium Lasers mounted on the base chassis, the Avatar A is a fearsome opponent with devastating close range punch. Restricted Actuators- Omni

Original: A fire support variant, the B configuration carries two LRM-15 racks and two LRM-10 racks. These are all mated to an Artemis IV Fire Control System. The only short range weaponry on the B configuration consists wholly of the two Medium Lasers mounted on the base chassis. Restricted Actuators- Omni
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_avatar_AV1-OB.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: A fire support variant, the B configuration carries two LRM-15 racks and two LRM-10 racks. These are all mated to an Artemis IV Fire Control System. The only short range weaponry on the B configuration consists wholly of the two Medium Lasers mounted on the base chassis. Restricted Actuators- Omni

Original: As a command configuration, the C configuration carries a C3 Master Computer into battle. The C configuration attempts to keep enemies at arms length with a PPC and Ultra Autocannon/5 supported by a pair of LRM-10 launchers. Restricted Actuators- Omni
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_avatar_AV1-OC.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: As a command configuration, the C configuration carries a C3 Master Computer into battle. The C configuration attempts to keep enemies at arms length with a PPC and Ultra Autocannon/5 supported by a pair of LRM-10 launchers. Restricted Actuators- Omni

Original: The D configuration is intended to act as a sniper. The primary weapon is a Light Gauss Rifle. For close to medium range combat, the Avatar D has two MRM-20 launchers and a pair of ER Medium Lasers in addition to the two hard-wired Medium Lasers. Finally, the D Configuration has a C3 Slave unit that allows it to work in C3 lances. Restricted Actuators- Omni
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_avatar_AV1-OD.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The D configuration is intended to act as a sniper. The primary weapon is a Light Gauss Rifle. For close to medium range combat, the Avatar D has two MRM-20 launchers and a pair of ER Medium Lasers in addition to the two hard-wired Medium Lasers. Finally, the D Configuration has a C3 Slave unit that allows it to work in C3 lances. Restricted Actuators- Omni

Original: A dedicated 'Mech killer, the Avatar G carries a Gauss Rifle with two tons of ammunition in each arm. Restricted Actuators- Omni
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_avatar_AV1-OG.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: A dedicated 'Mech killer, the Avatar G carries a Gauss Rifle with two tons of ammunition in each arm. Restricted Actuators- Omni

Original: A field upgrade developed in the midst of Operation Bulldog, this configuration utilized captured Clan Smoke Jaguar weapons to help bolster the SLDF forces in later waves. Mounting a mix of Combine and Clan-tech, this config carries an MRM-40 supported by a Clan Gauss Rifle, ER Large Laser and Streak SRM-4. Restricted Actuators- Omni
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_avatar_AV1-OR.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: A field upgrade developed in the midst of Operation Bulldog, this configuration utilized captured Clan Smoke Jaguar weapons to help bolster the SLDF forces in later waves. Mounting a mix of Combine and Clan-tech, this config carries an MRM-40 supported by a Clan Gauss Rifle, ER Large Laser and Streak SRM-4. Restricted Actuators- Omni

Original: A 'Mech that truly lives up to its name! The Awesome 8Q mounts a frightening trio of PPCs that can destroy, knock down, or debilitate any target in no time. It's ungainly, but it can shrug off huge amounts of incoming fire. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_awesome_AWS-8Q.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: A 'Mech that truly lives up to its name! The Awesome 8Q mounts a frightening trio of PPCs that can destroy, knock down, or debilitate any target in no time. It's ungainly, but it can shrug off huge amounts of incoming fire. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower

Original: The AWS-8R replaces the more expensive PPCs with a Large Laser and paired LRM-15s. While this variant can still dish out a similar amount of damage, it suffers from its dependency on a limited supply of ammunition. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_awesome_AWS-8R.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The AWS-8R replaces the more expensive PPCs with a Large Laser and paired LRM-15s. While this variant can still dish out a similar amount of damage, it suffers from its dependency on a limited supply of ammunition. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower

Original: The Awesome 8T is a superb fire support 'Mech, though its heavy armor is a bit wasted in that role. It can still put up a good fight at medium ranges, and it can crush smaller units outright with Melee attacks. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_awesome_AWS-8T.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The Awesome 8T is a superb fire support 'Mech, though its heavy armor is a bit wasted in that role. It can still put up a good fight at medium ranges, and it can crush smaller units outright with Melee attacks. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower

Original: Seeking to address the issues with the 8R model, the AWS-8V is a blend of the 8R and 8Q. This allows a pilot to provide indirect fire support, while still being a potent combatant with its PPC and Large Laser. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_awesome_AWS-8V.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: Seeking to address the issues with the 8R model, the AWS-8V is a blend of the 8R and 8Q. This allows a pilot to provide indirect fire support, while still being a potent combatant with its PPC and Large Laser. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower

Original: The 9M is an upgrade of the Awesome that uses Star League technologies. The 'Mech is built around a 320 Hermes XL Fusion engine, giving the 'Mech a top speed of 64.8 km/h. The heat sinks were upgraded to double heat sinks to allow this variant to be rearmed with three Fusigon Longtooth ER PPCs. The ER PPCs are backed up by two Hovertec Streak SRM-2s, split between the left arm and center torso and fed by one ton of reloads in the left leg, a Magna 400P Medium Pulse Laser also in the center torso, and a Diverse Optics Type 10 Small Pulse Laser in place of the head-mounted small laser. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_awesome_AWS-9M.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The 9M is an upgrade of the Awesome that uses Star League technologies. The 'Mech is built around a 320 Hermes XL Fusion engine, giving the 'Mech a top speed of 64.8 km/h. The heat sinks were upgraded to double heat sinks to allow this variant to be rearmed with three Fusigon Longtooth ER PPCs. The ER PPCs are backed up by two Hovertec Streak SRM-2s, split between the left arm and center torso and fed by one ton of reloads in the left leg, a Magna 400P Medium Pulse Laser also in the center torso, and a Diverse Optics Type 10 Small Pulse Laser in place of the head-mounted small laser. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower

Original: The Bane is a BattleMech that is based upon a Star League prototype that was never put into production. Tagged the Kraken by Inner Sphere forces who opposed it, the Bane was first built in 2827. It was originally a significant part of many Clan toumans, but was gradually relegated to second-line status following the introduction of the OmniMech. As such, it is still critical to many defensive units. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_Bane.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The Bane is a BattleMech that is based upon a Star League prototype that was never put into production. Tagged the Kraken by Inner Sphere forces who opposed it, the Bane was first built in 2827. It was originally a significant part of many Clan toumans, but was gradually relegated to second-line status following the introduction of the OmniMech. As such, it is still critical to many defensive units. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper

Original: The original design first produced in 2445, this Banshee variant carries the PPC, Autocannon/5, and Small Laser of the later 3E, as well as a pair of Medium Lasers.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_banshee_BNC-1E.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The original design first produced in 2445, this Banshee variant carries the PPC, Autocannon/5, and Small Laser of the later 3E, as well as a pair of Medium Lasers.

Original: The Banshee 3E was originally designed for close combat, with better speed than most other assault 'Mechs. While it has heavy armor and powerful Melee attack capability, its firepower is severely lacking and it can still be flanked by lighter units.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_banshee_BNC-3E.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The Banshee 3E was originally designed for close combat, with better speed than most other assault 'Mechs. While it has heavy armor and powerful Melee attack capability, its firepower is severely lacking and it can still be flanked by lighter units.

Original: The Banshee 3M mounts respectable weaponry with better-than-average speed and armor. This comes at the cost of very poor heat management. It's good at hunting lighter units, especially if it can close to Melee range.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_banshee_BNC-3M.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The Banshee 3M mounts respectable weaponry with better-than-average speed and armor. This comes at the cost of very poor heat management. It's good at hunting lighter units, especially if it can close to Melee range.

Original: The Banshee 3MC was a special design of the Magistracy of Canopus. It replaced the autocannon with a bigger one. To make room for it, most of the original heatsinks had to go.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_banshee_BNC-3MC.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The Banshee 3MC was a special design of the Magistracy of Canopus. It replaced the autocannon with a bigger one. To make room for it, most of the original heatsinks had to go.

Original: The Banshee 3Q variant lacks the long distance capabilities of its predecessor, replacing its AC10 and PPC with an AC20 and enough ammo to last in a sustained fight.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_banshee_BNC-3Q.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The Banshee 3Q variant lacks the long distance capabilities of its predecessor, replacing its AC10 and PPC with an AC20 and enough ammo to last in a sustained fight.

Original: A very recent variant, the 3S downgrades the engine size making the Banshee slower, but more than makes up for this by more than doubling its firepower.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_banshee_BNC-3S.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: A very recent variant, the 3S downgrades the engine size making the Banshee slower, but more than makes up for this by more than doubling its firepower.

Original: The original production variant of this 'Mech, the BKX-7K, utilizes two massive Donal Particle Projection Cannons, which were relatively new at the time. To support the massive cannons, it also has two Federated-5 Shot LRM-5 launchers with one ton of ammo to split between them and a Harpoon-6 SRM-6, giving it something to hit with at all ranges. Restricted Actuators- Left: Lower, Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_battleaxe_BKX-7K.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The original production variant of this 'Mech, the BKX-7K, utilizes two massive Donal Particle Projection Cannons, which were relatively new at the time. To support the massive cannons, it also has two Federated-5 Shot LRM-5 launchers with one ton of ammo to split between them and a Harpoon-6 SRM-6, giving it something to hit with at all ranges. Restricted Actuators- Left: Lower, Right: Lower

Original: With the introduction of the BattleAxe’s successor, the Hammerhands, no official variants ever surfaced. However, many MechWarriors, especially those who never quite learned to manage the BattleAxe as it leapt through the air, had technicians remove the temperamental jump jets and install a second LRM 5 in each torso, deeming it the “No Crash” version, or simply 7NC. Restricted Actuators- Left: Lower, Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_battleaxe_BKX-7NC.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: With the introduction of the BattleAxe’s successor, the Hammerhands, no official variants ever surfaced. However, many MechWarriors, especially those who never quite learned to manage the BattleAxe as it leapt through the air, had technicians remove the temperamental jump jets and install a second LRM 5 in each torso, deeming it the “No Crash” version, or simply 7NC. Restricted Actuators- Left: Lower, Right: Lower

Original: The Battle Hawk was originally designed and built at a time when Defiance Industries felt threatened by the large amount of equipment being produced by, and imported from, the Free Worlds League. It was built to prove that Defiance Industries was still an industry leader in BattleMechs. This came from a 'Mech that, while slow for its weight class, is a force to be reckoned with on the modern battlefield. The Battle Hawk has a top speed of 86.4 kph, which puts it on par with 'Mechs fifteen to twenty tons heavier than itself, but it also carries a powerful arsenal for its size. Its five and a half tons of armor give it good protection for a light 'Mech. Additionally, to make the Battle Hawk more maneuverable on the battlefield, it can jump up to one hundred and fifty meters.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_battlehawk_BH-K305.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The Battle Hawk was originally designed and built at a time when Defiance Industries felt threatened by the large amount of equipment being produced by, and imported from, the Free Worlds League. It was built to prove that Defiance Industries was still an industry leader in BattleMechs. This came from a 'Mech that, while slow for its weight class, is a force to be reckoned with on the modern battlefield. The Battle Hawk has a top speed of 86.4 kph, which puts it on par with 'Mechs fifteen to twenty tons heavier than itself, but it also carries a powerful arsenal for its size. Its five and a half tons of armor give it good protection for a light 'Mech. Additionally, to make the Battle Hawk more maneuverable on the battlefield, it can jump up to one hundred and fifty meters.

Original: A upgrade Battlemaster 1DC Command refit, carrying advanced Technologies and Hardened Armour to stay in the fight as long as possible.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_battlemaster_BLR-1CX.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: A upgrade Battlemaster 1DC Command refit, carrying advanced Technologies and Hardened Armour to stay in the fight as long as possible.

Original: More of a refit than a production variant, the SRM-6 and two Medium Lasers are removed so that six Heat Sinks and an extra ton of armor could be added.  Making the BLR-1D a formitable opponent.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_battlemaster_BLR-1D.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: More of a refit than a production variant, the SRM-6 and two Medium Lasers are removed so that six Heat Sinks and an extra ton of armor could be added.  Making the BLR-1D a formitable opponent.

Original: Command Console refit built in 2855 - The BattleMaster was one of the Federated Suns' preferred 'Mechs to install Command Consoles. Standard refits usually installed the Command Console on the BLR-1G, removing one heat sink and both rear-mounted Medium Lasers.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_battlemaster_BLR-1G-DC.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: Command Console refit built in 2855 - The BattleMaster was one of the Federated Suns' preferred 'Mechs to install Command Consoles. Standard refits usually installed the Command Console on the BLR-1G, removing one heat sink and both rear-mounted Medium Lasers.

Original: Versatile and powerful, the BattleMaster 1G is one of the best known BattleMechs in existence. Normally mounting a varied array of Energy weapons, the BattleMaster can engage enemies at any range and packs a powerful punch.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_battlemaster_BLR-1G.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: Versatile and powerful, the BattleMaster 1G is one of the best known BattleMechs in existence. Normally mounting a varied array of Energy weapons, the BattleMaster can engage enemies at any range and packs a powerful punch.

Original: A new variant produced for the Lyran Commonwealth by Red Devil industries which changes its mission profile to be more of a support 'Mech, removing its PPC and SRM-6 and replacing them with an LRM-15, LRM-5 and a pair of SRM-2s.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_battlemaster_BLR-1S.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: A new variant produced for the Lyran Commonwealth by Red Devil industries which changes its mission profile to be more of a support 'Mech, removing its PPC and SRM-6 and replacing them with an LRM-15, LRM-5 and a pair of SRM-2s.

Original: The Black Hawk-KU is an Inner Sphere version of the Clan Black Hawk OmniMech. In order to make it possible to copy the Black Hawk, the Black Hawk-KU is built ten tons heavier than its Clan counterpart. The Black Hawk-KU is built on a sixty ton chassis and is powered by a Vlar 300 XL Engine which propels it to a top speed of 86.4 kph. Restricted Actuators- Omni

Original: Blackjack 0s are Primitive downgrades of the BJ-1, replacing both AC's with Medium Rifles, and maximizing armour as best as it can. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_blackjack_BJ-0.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: Blackjack 0s are Primitive downgrades of the BJ-1, replacing both AC's with Medium Rifles, and maximizing armour as best as it can. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper

Original: Blackjack 1s are solid, well-rounded 'Mechs for their tonnage. They typically mount Jump Jets, which give them an extra edge by repositioning quickly to keep a direct line of fire for their Autocannons. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_blackjack_BJ-1.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: Blackjack 1s are solid, well-rounded 'Mechs for their tonnage. They typically mount Jump Jets, which give them an extra edge by repositioning quickly to keep a direct line of fire for their Autocannons. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper

Original: A recent Federated Suns variant, the BJ-1DB replaces the AutoCannon with Large Lasers. In order to assist with the added heat, it also drops some armor and the torso mounted lasers to make room for more Heat Sinks. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_blackjack_BJ-1DB.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: A recent Federated Suns variant, the BJ-1DB replaces the AutoCannon with Large Lasers. In order to assist with the added heat, it also drops some armor and the torso mounted lasers to make room for more Heat Sinks. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper

Original: Sacrificing the Jump Jets, the BJ-1DC adds a Small Laser in each side torso and a Heat Sink to help ease the extra burden. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_blackjack_BJ-1DC.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: Sacrificing the Jump Jets, the BJ-1DC adds a Small Laser in each side torso and a Heat Sink to help ease the extra burden. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper

Original: In The Periphery Maintaining Mechs Tends To Be A Problem, As A Result The 1P Was Designed Generally As A Downgrade From The Os, But Much Cheaper To Maintain And Repair, Pilots Often Complain About The Structure 'Making Strange Noises', These Remarks Were Usually Ignored. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_blackjack_BJ-1P.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: In The Periphery Maintaining Mechs Tends To Be A Problem, As A Result The 1P Was Designed Generally As A Downgrade From The Os, But Much Cheaper To Maintain And Repair, Pilots Often Complain About The Structure 'Making Strange Noises', These Remarks Were Usually Ignored. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper

Original: This early Blackjack prototype started along a completely different path for the 'Mech. Focusing on close in weapons, the BJ-1X has four Flamers and four Medium Lasers. The BJ-1X also focused more on speed than jump manueverability, increasing the engine size while removing the Jump Jets. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_blackjack_BJ-1X.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: This early Blackjack prototype started along a completely different path for the 'Mech. Focusing on close in weapons, the BJ-1X has four Flamers and four Medium Lasers. The BJ-1X also focused more on speed than jump manueverability, increasing the engine size while removing the Jump Jets. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper

Original: The BJ-2 was introduced in 3052 by the Federated Suns as the new production model of the Blackjack, based on earlier experimental designs. It upgrades the 'Mech with two Diverse Optics Sunbeam ER Large Lasers in place of the autocannons and removes the medium lasers for four Hovertec Streak SRM-2 launchers, two each in the left and right sides of the torso. One ton of ammo for the launchers is kept in the left torso while the standard heat sinks were upgraded to double heat sinks. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_blackjack_BJ-2.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The BJ-2 was introduced in 3052 by the Federated Suns as the new production model of the Blackjack, based on earlier experimental designs. Original: In the 3030s, the St. Ives Compact experimented with recovered technology on some of their Blackjacks. One prototype that showed great promise replace the autocannon and one heat sink with a pair of Ceres Arms Smasher PPCs. Three of the remaining heat sinks were replaced with experimental “freezer” double efficiency units. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_blackjack_BJ-3.Details

Three of the remaining heat sinks were replaced with experimental “freezer” double efficiency units. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper

Original: The Blackjack 3T replaces the standard AC/2s with Large Laser, providing greater punch at the cost of some Heat and carries a large collection of Machine guns and 2 Small Lasers. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_blackjack_BJ-3T.Details

Original: The Blackjack 5 is a rather unusual refit, replacing the Autocannons with a pair of Mortars to allow indirect firing support and giving AMS coverage. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_blackjack_BJ-5.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The Blackjack 5 is a rather unusual refit, replacing the Autocannons with a pair of Mortars to allow indirect firing support and giving AMS coverage. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper

Original: The Blackjack G, unlike the average variant, carries twin Ultra AC/10s. This variant also features an advanced targeting computer, an ultra-light gyro, and a supercharger. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_blackjack_BJ-G.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The Blackjack G, unlike the average variant, carries twin Ultra AC/10s. This variant also features an advanced targeting computer, an ultra-light gyro, and a supercharger. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper

Original: An upgrade of the Blackjack BattleMech, the Blackjack OmniMech is a powerful and adaptable medium weight workhorse. Much like the Firestarter OmniMech, the genesis of the omni-Blackjack stems from the Combine's technology exchange program during the initial Clan Invasion with Ceres Metals Industries ' St. Ives Compact branch offering Luthien Armor Works specifications and licences to manufacturer the ill-regarded Blackjack.Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_blackjack_BJ2-O.Details

Original: The Black Knight 6-KNT is a dedicated Energy weapon platform. It can shell out hellish damage with its beams and shrug off a lot of damage… just gotta make sure to keep its heat in check.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_blackknight_BL-6-KNT.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The Black Knight 6-KNT is a dedicated Energy weapon platform. It can shell out hellish damage with its beams and shrug off a lot of damage… just gotta make sure to keep its heat in check.

Original: The Black Knight 6B was the harder-hitting, cooler-running Star League ancestor to the standard BL-6-KNT we have today. It did everything the 6 does, but better—mostly thanks to its Double Heat Sinks.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_blackknight_BL-6b-KNT.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The Black Knight 6B was the harder-hitting, cooler-running Star League ancestor to the standard BL-6-KNT we have today. It did everything the 6 does, but better—mostly thanks to its Double Heat Sinks.

Original: A Free Worlds League variant, the BL-7-KNT-L replaces the rarer PPC with a 3rd Large Laser and 2 additional Heat Sinks.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_blackknight_BL-7-KNT-L.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: A Free Worlds League variant, the BL-7-KNT-L replaces the rarer PPC with a 3rd Large Laser and 2 additional Heat Sinks.

Original: The Black Knight 7-KNT is a dedicated Energy weapon platform. It can shell out hellish damage with its beams and shrug off a lot of damage… just gotta make sure to keep its heat in check.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_blackknight_BL-7-KNT.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The Black Knight 7-KNT is a dedicated Energy weapon platform. It can shell out hellish damage with its beams and shrug off a lot of damage… just gotta make sure to keep its heat in check.

Original: The Black Knight 7B is a refit made for and sold to Mercenary Commanders deeply in favour with the Federated Commonwealth, sporting advanced Technologys and Prototype X-Pulse Laser.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_blackknight_BL-7b-KNT.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The Black Knight 7B is a refit made for and sold to Mercenary Commanders deeply in favour with the Federated Commonwealth, sporting advanced Technologys and Prototype X-Pulse Laser.

Original: The Black Knight 9-KNT is essentially a LosTech upgrade to the 6 variant, replacing most of its standard lasers with pulse versions, and the standard PPC with an ER version. This variant also carries double heat sinks to manage the extra heat generated by these weapons.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_blackknight_BL-9-KNT.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The Black Knight 9-KNT is essentially a LosTech upgrade to the 6 variant, replacing most of its standard lasers with pulse versions, and the standard PPC with an ER version. This variant also carries double heat sinks to manage the extra heat generated by these weapons.

Original: The Black Lanner A is configured for electronic warfare and scouting. It uses an Active Probe to find hidden units, an ECM Suite to counteract enemy electronics, and a TAG spotting laser to designate targets for homing artillery. Offensively, it can call upon an ER PPC and a pair of Medium Pulse Lasers. Restricted Actuators- Omni
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_blacklanner_BKL-A.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The Black Lanner A is configured for electronic warfare and scouting. It uses an Active Probe to find hidden units, an ECM Suite to counteract enemy electronics, and a TAG spotting laser to designate targets for homing artillery. Offensively, it can call upon an ER PPC and a pair of Medium Pulse Lasers. Restricted Actuators- Omni

Original: The C is a close-support variant that mounts six ER Medium Lasers and a Streak SRM-6. It also uses three additional double heat sinks to help combat heat levels. Restricted Actuators- Omni
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_blacklanner_BKL-C.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The C is a close-support variant that mounts six ER Medium Lasers and a Streak SRM-6. It also uses three additional double heat sinks to help combat heat levels. Restricted Actuators- Omni

Original: This close-range brawler mounts pairs of Medium Pulse Lasers, SRM-6s, ER Small Lasers, Flamers, and four Machine Guns. This configuration is devastating to conventional infantry and a serious threat to combat vehicles. An Active Probe ensures that it is rarely surprised. Restricted Actuators- Omni
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_blacklanner_BKL-D.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: This close-range brawler mounts pairs of Medium Pulse Lasers, SRM-6s, ER Small Lasers, Flamers, and four Machine Guns. This configuration is devastating to conventional infantry and a serious threat to combat vehicles. An Active Probe ensures that it is rarely surprised. Restricted Actuators- Omni

Original: The primary configuration of the Black Lanner is effective at all ranges. At long range, it can make use of an ER Large Laser and LRM-10. When it closes in, it can attack with a pair of ER Medium Lasers and an SRM-6 that can exploit holes in its opponent's armor. An ECM Suite protects it from many forms of electronics. Restricted Actuators- Omni
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_blacklanner_BKL-PRIME.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The primary configuration of the Black Lanner is effective at all ranges. At long range, it can make use of an ER Large Laser and LRM-10. When it closes in, it can attack with a pair of ER Medium Lasers and an SRM-6 that can exploit holes in its opponent's armor. An ECM Suite protects it from many forms of electronics. Restricted Actuators- Omni

Original: Taking its name from a term meaning 'Lightning War' the Blitzkrieg completely lives up to the name. The Blitzkrieg is built on a lightweight Coventry BTZ-VII Endo Steel chassis and is powered by a Magna 350 XL engine that weighs half as much as a standard fusion engine while giving the 'Mech a top speed of 118.8 km/h. Restricted Actuators- Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_blitzkrieg_BTZ-3F.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: Taking its name from a term meaning 'Lightning War' the Blitzkrieg completely lives up to the name. The Blitzkrieg is built on a lightweight Coventry BTZ-VII Endo Steel chassis and is powered by a Magna 350 XL engine that weighs half as much as a standard fusion engine while giving the 'Mech a top speed of 118.8 km/h. Restricted Actuators- Lower

Original: Though bearing a remarkable outward resemblance to the Timberwolf, this BattleMech is a new and powerful creation. Carrying thirteen tons of ferro-fibrous armor, the Mad Cat MK II is an incredibly resilient design. A pair of arm mounted Gaussrifles supported by torso mounted LRM racks give it complete command over the battlefield. Restricted Actuators- Omni
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_bloodasp_A.Details

Original: The original Bombard mounted a pair of massive Autocannon/20s in place of the Thunderbolt launchers as well as standard Medium Lasers instead of the MBM-013's ER lasers. This version was also equipped with experimental War of 3039-vintage double heat sinks, less bulky than standard double heat sinks, but which utilized corrosive coolant.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_bombard_BMB-010.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The original Bombard mounted a pair of massive Autocannon/20s in place of the Thunderbolt launchers as well as standard Medium Lasers instead of the MBM-013's ER lasers. This version was also equipped with experimental War of 3039-vintage double heat sinks, less bulky than standard double heat sinks, but which utilized corrosive coolant.

Original: The Brigand is a BattleMech that is surrounded by a sea of controversy as it is the first 'Mech to be produced by a pirate band. Manufactured by a company named Vengeance Incorporated, which is run by the pirates of the Haven Star Cluster and 'Lady Death' Trevaline, the Brigand represents an unprecedented threat because in spite of the fact that it is built by pirates, it uses advanced construction techniques and weapons.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_brigand_LDT-1.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The Brigand is a BattleMech that is surrounded by a sea of controversy as it is the first 'Mech to be produced by a pirate band. Manufactured by a company named Vengeance Incorporated, which is run by the pirates of the Haven Star Cluster and 'Lady Death' Trevaline, the Brigand represents an unprecedented threat because in spite of the fact that it is built by pirates, it uses advanced construction techniques and weapons.

Original: The Bushwacker was originally a failed BattleMech designed to have a smaller forward profile to make the 'Mech a harder target to hit. The Bushwacker's unique design caused problems with the engine shielding, the side-effects of which manifested themselves as various gremlins in the 'Mech's on board electronics on the prototypes fielded. Restricted Actuators- Left: Lower, Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_bushwacker_BWS-S2.Details

Original: Originally a reverse-engineered version Cataphract the finished design surprisingly enough proving to be a high quality design itself.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_caesar_CES-3R.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: Originally a reverse-engineered version Cataphract the finished design surprisingly enough proving to be a high quality design itself.

Original: We call the Cataphract a "FrankenMech" because it's got a little bit of everything stitched together on it. The 1X model works well at medium-long to closer range, with good armor and weaponry. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_cataphract_CTF-1X.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: We call the Cataphract a "FrankenMech" because it's got a little bit of everything stitched together on it. The 1X model works well at medium-long to closer range, with good armor and weaponry. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower

Original: The 2X replaces the PPC with a heavy laser, while the arm-mounted medium lasers are removed in favor of a SRM-4. This reduction in heat load also allows for the removal of 2 heat sinks and adding armor in their stead. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_cataphract_CTF-2X.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The 2X replaces the PPC with a heavy laser, while the arm-mounted medium lasers are removed in favor of a SRM-4. This reduction in heat load also allows for the removal of 2 heat sinks and adding armor in their stead. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower

Original: The CTF-4X is the latest variant of this prototype 'Mech. The 4X downgrades the Engine, making for a slower ride, but adds more long range firepower with two Autocannon 5s, a Large Laser and LRM5. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_cataphract_CTF-4X.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The CTF-4X is the latest variant of this prototype 'Mech. The 4X downgrades the Engine, making for a slower ride, but adds more long range firepower with two Autocannon 5s, a Large Laser and LRM5. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower

Original: The Catapult A1 was designed as a true support role model. The CPLT-A1 removes all 4 Medium Lasers in favor of additional LRM ammunition and armor. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_catapult_CPLT-A1.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The Catapult A1 was designed as a true support role model. The CPLT-A1 removes all 4 Medium Lasers in favor of additional LRM ammunition and armor. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper

Original: Ah, the Catapult C1. Just like its namesake, it's good at lobbing large numbers of missiles over terrain without fear of return fire. Surprisingly, it's also not too shabby at closer ranges in a pinch. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_catapult_CPLT-C1.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: Ah, the Catapult C1. Just like its namesake, it's good at lobbing large numbers of missiles over terrain without fear of return fire. Surprisingly, it's also not too shabby at closer ranges in a pinch. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper

Original: The Royal Catapult, the -C1b was designed to fill the same role as the normal -C1 but better. Thanks to Ferro-Fibrous armor it sports better protection, and thanks to double heat sinks it can jump and fire all day long without problems. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_catapult_CPLT-C1b.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The Royal Catapult, the -C1b was designed to fill the same role as the normal -C1 but better. Thanks to Ferro-Fibrous armor it sports better protection, and thanks to double heat sinks it can jump and fire all day long without problems. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper

Original: The CPLT-C4 is an explosive addition to any outfit's arsenal. Trading out the stock LRM-15s, Medium Lasers and extra Heat Sinks for LRM-20s and Small Lasers - along with 2 extra tons of ammo, the C4 gives the Catapult impressive long range firepower. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_catapult_CPLT-C4.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The CPLT-C4 is an explosive addition to any outfit's arsenal. Trading out the stock LRM-15s, Medium Lasers and extra Heat Sinks for LRM-20s and Small Lasers - along with 2 extra tons of ammo, the C4 gives the Catapult impressive long range firepower. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper

Original: The Catapult K2 is an outside-the-box redesign that trades the indirect-fire capability for heavier direct-fire PPCs. It doesn't usually mount Jump Jets, though, so it can be a bit more restricted in its use. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_catapult_CPLT-K2.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The Catapult K2 is an outside-the-box redesign that trades the indirect-fire capability for heavier direct-fire PPCs. It doesn't usually mount Jump Jets, though, so it can be a bit more restricted in its use. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper

Original: An upgrade of the K2 Catapult, the K2K model changes the engine to an extralight model. The twin PPCs also have been upgraded to ER PPCs. The 'Mech carries two ER Medium Lasers for close range firepower. To handle the added heat from the upgrades, the 'Mech uses 20 double heat sinks. Finally, the K2K model carries thirteen and a half tons of armor. . Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_catapult_CPLT-K2K.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: An upgrade of the K2 Catapult, the K2K model changes the engine to an extralight model. The twin PPCs also have been upgraded to ER PPCs. The 'Mech carries two ER Medium Lasers for close range firepower. To handle the added heat from the upgrades, the 'Mech uses 20 double heat sinks. Finally, the K2K model carries thirteen and a half tons of armor. . Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper

Original: Though this design never reached full production, it was prototyped during the War of 3039. It upgrades the PPCs of the K2 to ER PPCs. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_catapult_CPLT-K3.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: Though this design never reached full production, it was prototyped during the War of 3039. It upgrades the PPCs of the K2 to ER PPCs. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper

Original: Another Kuritan variant, the -K5 goes back to its roots by carrying two MRM-30 launchers as its primary weapon. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_catapult_CPLT-K5.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: Another Kuritan variant, the -K5 goes back to its roots by carrying two MRM-30 launchers as its primary weapon. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper

Original: The CattleMaster was created at the turn of the thirty-first century as an IndustrialMech to handle large herd animals. The concept for the Rancher 'Mech dates back to the twenty-fourth century. The 'Mech is noted for its durability and flexible Internal Combustion Engine.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_cattlemaster-CM-3R2.Details

The concept for the Rancher 'Mech dates back to the twenty-fourth century. The 'Mech is noted for its durability and flexible Internal Combustion Engine.

Original: The CattleMaster was created at the turn of the thirty-first century as an IndustrialMech to handle large herd animals. Being fed up by local Troublemakers and Pirates trying to steal his livestock, one farmer went and upgraded his Cattlemaster.

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The CattleMaster was created at the turn of the thirty-first century as an IndustrialMech to handle large herd animals. Being fed up by local Troublemakers and Pirates trying to steal his livestock, one farmer went and upgraded his Cattlemaster.

Original: A primitive downgrade of the Centurion-9A commonly found among LowTech States and Bandits. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: A primitive downgrade of the Centurion-9A commonly found among LowTech States and Bandits. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower

Original: A sturdy and reliable 'Mech, the Centurion is good at both taking and giving a beating. CN9-A models are able to engage at any range, but their damage curve increases as they approach a target. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_centurion_CN9-A.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: A sturdy and reliable 'Mech, the Centurion is good at both taking and giving a beating. CN9-A models are able to engage at any range, but their damage curve increases as they approach a target. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower

Original: A sturdy and reliable 'Mech, the Centurion is good at both taking and giving a beating. CN9-A2 models come with a UAC/10 and usually carry Hotloaded LRMs. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_centurion_CN9-A2.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: A sturdy and reliable 'Mech, the Centurion is good at both taking and giving a beating. CN9-A2 models come with a UAC/10 and usually carry Hotloaded LRMs. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower

Original: A somewhat radical departure from the stock Centurion, the CN9-AH Variant trades out the stock AC10 and Medium Lasers for a single AC20. While this amounts to the same degree of firepower, it has the benefit of concentrating the damage to a single location. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_centurion_CN9-AH.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: A somewhat radical departure from the stock Centurion, the CN9-AH Variant trades out the stock AC10 and Medium Lasers for a single AC20. While this amounts to the same degree of firepower, it has the benefit of concentrating the damage to a single location. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower

Original: The AL variant of the Centurion tends to trade the larger burst damage of an Autocannon for more Energy weaponry and heavier armor. ALs can take an incredible amount of damage for their size but still pack a good punch.Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_centurion_CN9-AL.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The AL variant of the Centurion tends to trade the larger burst damage of an Autocannon for more Energy weaponry and heavier armor. ALs can take an incredible amount of damage for their size but still pack a good punch.Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower

Original: A sturdy and reliable 'Mech, the Centurion is good at both taking and giving a beating. CN9-B1 models are able to engage at extreme range thanks to a Light Gauss Rifle and stay in the field with their AMS and Medium Shield. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_centurion_CN9-B1.Details

Original: A sturdy and reliable 'Mech, the Centurion is good at both taking and giving a beating. CN9-D models are upgraded for a LB-X AC and Artemis supported MML. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_centurion_CN9-D.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: A sturdy and reliable 'Mech, the Centurion is good at both taking and giving a beating. CN9-D models are upgraded for a LB-X AC and Artemis supported MML. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower

Original: The CN9-D3 variant introduced in 3052 is identical to the CN9-D Centurion with one exceptional difference. The D3 uses Triple Strength Myomer to increase its top speed up to 118.8 kph while it is running hot. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_centurion_CN9-D3.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The CN9-D3 variant introduced in 3052 is identical to the CN9-D Centurion with one exceptional difference. The D3 uses Triple Strength Myomer to increase its top speed up to 118.8 kph while it is running hot. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower

Original: The D3D variant of this 'Mech is a potent long-range sniper, first built in 3060. It uses the same chassis and engine combination as the D3 variant but uses MASC to augment its movement to give it a maximum speed of 129.6 kph. The primary weapon on the D3D is a Light Gauss Rifle. For added long range assistance, the 'Mech carries an LRM-10 launcher and for close range combat it carries an ER Medium Laser. This is all protected with eight tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor. Restricted Actuators- Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_centurion_CN9-D3D.Details

Name: Base_3061.mechdef_centurion_CN9-H.Details

Original: The Chameleon was designed to help a new MechWarrior master the skills of maneuvering and heat management, with a top speed of 97.2 kph and a jumping distance of one hundred and eighty meters. The 'Mech also had an almost all energy weapons loadout, but cooled only by ten standard heat sinks. This paucity of freezers forces MechWarriors to concentrate on the 'Mech's heat levels. In some instances, the Chameleon had been forced into combat situations, notably during the Dragoon Civil War. Production of the Chameleon halted briefly in 3052 when Defiance Industries decided to switch its production to the Nightsky, but was quickly resumed when J.B. BattleMechs Incorporated purchased the rights to the design. J.B. BattleMechs also introduced two battle-worthy variants of the Chameleon. The Chameleon is a training 'Mech, intended to simulate a variety of opponents by mounting a wide variety of weapon systems. A Chameleon is a medium 'Mech, but it doesn't always look like one. It can be fitted out with extra plates to modify its appearance, and carries special electronics to falsify its signature; these special abilities let it look and scan as something other than what it is, hence the machine's name.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_chameleon_CLN-7V.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The Chameleon was designed to help a new MechWarrior master the skills of maneuvering and heat management, with a top speed of 97.2 kph and a jumping distance of one hundred and eighty meters. The 'Mech also had an almost all energy weapons loadout, but cooled only by ten standard heat sinks. This paucity of freezers forces MechWarriors to concentrate on the 'Mech's heat levels. In some instances, the Chameleon had been forced into combat situations, notably during the Dragoon Civil War. It can be fitted out with extra plates to modify its appearance, and carries special electronics to falsify its signature; these special abilities let it look and scan as something other than what it is, hence the machine's name.

BattleMechs Incorporated purchased the rights to the design. J.B. BattleMechs also introduced two battle-worthy variants of the Chameleon. The Chameleon is a training 'Mech, intended to simulate a variety of opponents by mounting a wide variety of weapon systems. A Chameleon is a medium 'Mech, but it doesn't always look like one. It can be fitted out with extra plates to modify its appearance, and carries special electronics to falsify its signature; these special abilities let it look and scan as something other than what it is, hence the machine's name.

Original: The Chameleon was designed to help a new MechWarrior master the skills of maneuvering and heat management, with a top speed of 97.2 kph and a jumping distance of one hundred and eighty meters. The 'Mech also had an almost all energy weapons loadout, but cooled only by ten standard heat sinks. This paucity of freezers forces MechWarriors to concentrate on the 'Mech's heat levels. In some instances, the Chameleon had been forced into combat situations, notably during the Dragoon Civil War. Production of the Chameleon halted briefly in 3052 when Defiance Industries decided to switch its production to the Nightsky, but was quickly resumed when J.B. Original: Where the CHP-2N is the downgraded Succession Wars variant of the Champion, the -1N is the fully powered Star League variant and is the original one the designers introduced. The high speed for a mech its size remains as does the somewhat anemic armor, the main benefit the mech gets from Star League technology is found in the weaponry: a LB-10X Autocannon, a SRM 6 with an Artemis IV system, and a pair each of Medium and Small Lasers. Otherwise, the -1N is much the same as the -2N and performs the same in many ways. Restricted Actuators- Left: Lower, Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_champion_CHP-1N.Details

Original: During the Star League when the Champion-1N was in full production, there was a frequent pilot modification that turned into a production variant. This mech, the -1N2, is exactly the same as the -1N with the exception of the heat sinks, which have been upgraded to doubles. In all other respects, the -1N2 is the same as the -1N. Restricted Actuators- Left: Lower, Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_champion_CHP-1N2.Details

Restricted Actuators- Left: Lower, Right: Lower

Original: A variant reserved for SLDF Royal units, this Champion was introduced in 2751 and replaces all the standard weaponry with a Gauss Rifle and ER PPC. It also uses double heat sinks. This gave the -1Nb an extremely long range weapon profile and a serious punch while also solving its heat issues. Restricted Actuators- Left: Lower, Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_champion_CHP-1Nb.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: A variant reserved for SLDF Royal units, this Champion was introduced in 2751 and replaces all the standard weaponry with a Gauss Rifle and ER PPC. Original: The Champion debuted in 2602 as a generalist combat 'Mech with a focus on heavy reconnaissance and fast strike capabilities. While definitely faster and more maneuverable than other heavy 'Mechs, it was criticized by many for being too large, underarmed and underarmored. The armament on the Champion is considered by many to be feeble for its size, especially after losing its advanced technology from the Star League. Carrying an AC/10, a SRM 6, and a pair each of Medium and Small Lasers, the Champion is woefully underarmed for its size. Restricted Actuators- Left: Lower, Right: Lower
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_champion_CHP-2N.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The Champion debuted in 2602 as a generalist combat 'Mech with a focus on heavy reconnaissance and fast strike capabilities. Original: The Charger is seen as an example of abject failure in BattleMech design. Wells Technologies originally wanted to produce an ultra-heavy scout 'Mech for the Star League Defense Force that was not only fast but could survive contact with the enemy. This was done by building the Charger on an 80-ton frame, making it the heaviest scout 'Mech in existence, and powering it with a massive LTV 400 fusion engine that took up almost sixty percent of the Charger's mass. With a top speed which allowed it to outrun most other 'Mechs the Charger was then given ten tons of Durallex Heavy armor, enough to survive repeated hits from a Class 20 Autocannon. However these features left very little room for offensive capability, an intentional deficiency on the part of the design team as they saw any task other than gathering data a distraction.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_charger_CGR-1A1.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The Charger is seen as an example of abject failure in BattleMech design. Wells Technologies originally wanted to produce an ultra-heavy scout 'Mech for the Star League Defense Force that was not only fast but could survive contact with the enemy. With a top speed which allowed it to outrun most other 'Mechs the Charger was then given ten tons of Durallex Heavy armor, enough to survive repeated hits from a Class 20 Autocannon. However these features left very little room for offensive capability, an intentional deficiency on the part of the design team as they saw any task other than gathering data a distraction.

Original: The 1A5 variant of the Charger was one of the first variants of the Charger made to take it from the role of scout to assault 'Mech. A Capellan modification to the CGR-1Ls they received as part of the Kapteyn Accords, the engine was downgraded to a 320 version, which reduced the maximum speed of the 'Mech to 64.8 km/h, and four of the small lasers were removed. In their place was a Tomodzuru Autocannon/20 as its primary weapon, two Bical SRM-6 launchers and an Argra 3L Medium Laser, while the 'Mech's armor was increased by five tons. This made the CGR-1A5 extremely dangerous at close ranges and gave it a speed comparable to most 'Mechs in the heavy weight class, while carrying armor on par with other eighty-ton 'Mechs.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_charger_CGR-1A5.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The 1A5 variant of the Charger was one of the first variants of the Charger made to take it from the role of scout to assault 'Mech. A Capellan modification to the CGR-1Ls they received as part of the Kapteyn Accords, the engine was downgraded to a 320 version, which reduced the maximum speed of the 'Mech to 64.8 km/h, and four of the small lasers were removed. In their place was a Tomodzuru Autocannon/20 as its primary weapon, two Bical SRM-6 launchers and an Argra 3L Medium Laser, while the 'Mech's armor was increased by five tons. This made the CGR-1A5 extremely dangerous at close ranges and gave it a speed comparable to most 'Mechs in the heavy weight class, while carrying armor on par with other eighty-ton 'Mechs.

Original: A Combine-LAW attempt to make the Charger more effective at long ranges, the 1A9 used a reduced 320-rated engine, lowering its top speed to 64.8 km/h, and its arsenal was overhauled. All of the smaller lasers (except for the head mounted one) were replaced with medium lasers and a single LRM-20 launcher was mounted in the right torso, with two tons of reloads carried in the left torso. To make up for the lost mobility, four jump jets were also installed, two in each leg, to allow the Charger to jump up to one hundred and twenty meters. This variant was fielded in time to surprise the Armed Forces of the Federated Suns during the War of 3039, but in years since the design fell into the hands of the Outworlds Alliance thanks to a legal snafu which gave Ravenna Electronics a production license.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_charger_CGR-1A9.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: A Combine-LAW attempt to make the Charger more effective at long ranges, the 1A9 used a reduced 320-rated engine, lowering its top speed to 64.8 km/h, and its arsenal was overhauled. All of the smaller lasers (except for the head mounted one) were replaced with medium lasers and a single LRM-20 launcher was mounted in the right torso, with two tons of reloads carried in the left torso. To make up for the lost mobility, four jump jets were also installed, two in each leg, to allow the Charger to jump up to one hundred and twenty meters. This variant was fielded in time to surprise the Armed Forces of the Federated Suns during the War of 3039, but in years since the design fell into the hands of the Outworlds Alliance thanks to a legal snafu which gave Ravenna Electronics a production license.

Original: An export model sold to the Capellan Confederation as part of the Kapteyn Accords, the CGR-1L was a simple modification of the Charger in an attempt to make it more effective following their disastrous use on Chara in 3023. In place of four and a half tons of armor and all five Small Lasers, the 1L mounts a Large Laser in its right arm and two medium lasers in either side torso. While more prone to overheating and less protected - mounting armor comparable to that of a traditional scout 'Mech - it was better capable of defending itself against other scout 'Mechs, and at the time that was good enough for the desperate warriors of the Capellan Confederation Armed Forces. Since then, the CGR-1L has remained in Capellan service as a training 'Mech and, according to rumor, punishment assignment for dissident soldiers.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_charger_CGR-1L.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: An export model sold to the Capellan Confederation as part of the Kapteyn Accords, the CGR-1L was a simple modification of the Charger in an attempt to make it more effective following their disastrous use on Chara in 3023. In place of four and a half tons of armor and all five Small Lasers, the 1L mounts a Large Laser in its right arm and two medium lasers in either side torso. Original: This radical modification looks to turn the Charger into a traditional assault 'Mech by reducing the 'Mechs speed to 54 km/h, which allows the use of a smaller engine (incidentally, the commonplace Pitban 240 reactor). The 'Mech is armored with fifteen and a half tons of armor and is armed with four Large Lasers, one in each arm and side torso, and a Medium Laser in its head; twenty-eight heat sinks kept the 'Mech cool.
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_charger_CGR-SB.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: This radical modification looks to turn the Charger into a traditional assault 'Mech by reducing the 'Mechs speed to 54 km/h, which allows the use of a smaller engine (incidentally, the commonplace Pitban 240 reactor). The 'Mech is armored with fifteen and a half tons of armor and is armed with four Large Lasers, one in each arm and side torso, and a Medium Laser in its head; twenty-eight heat sinks kept the 'Mech cool.

Original: In all honesty, Cicadas as a rule are very fragile. The 2A model was designed to be as fast as any light 'Mech, but that massive engine leaves little room for much else. Still, if you use it cautiously, it can be a successful scout and diversion. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_cicada_CDA-2A.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: In all honesty, Cicadas as a rule are very fragile. The 2A model was designed to be as fast as any light 'Mech, but that massive engine leaves little room for much else. Original: A swap out of the 2A's Small Laser and half a ton of armor for a Flamer, this 'Mech can be quickly maneuvered in to heat up an oppoent that is already having issues. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_cicada_CDA-2B.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: A swap out of the 2A's Small Laser and half a ton of armor for a Flamer, this 'Mech can be quickly maneuvered in to heat up an oppoent that is already having issues. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper

Original: A typical Periphery raider, the Cicada 2P is fast and hard hitting but lacks endurance and cannot survive long once it has delivered it's payload. 4 RL-20's make up the bulk of the mechs firepower, capable of threatening even an Assault mech if used correctly. The secondary weapons are a pair of medium chem lasers with a ton of ammo between them. Achieving almost identical speeds to its Inner Sphere counterparts, the 2P is designed as a heavy scout and head hunter with a nasty alpha strike capable of shredding most opponents regardless of the target. Designed to be easy to maintain and even easier to replace, the 2P is built with parts that can be salvaged from most battlefields or brought in any number of back street bazaars or disreputable arms markets. Indeed, most new 2P’s are often repurposed wrecks hauled off the battlefield and rebuilt as quickly as possible. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_cicada_CDA-2P.Details

Original: The Cicada 3C is slightly slower than the 2A but has more room for weaponry and armor. It still generally underperforms in most areas except speed, but it can put up more of a fight, with better survival rates. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_cicada_CDA-3C.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The Cicada 3C is slightly slower than the 2A but has more room for weaponry and armor. It still generally underperforms in most areas except speed, but it can put up more of a fight, with better survival rates. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper

Original: A somewhat unusual design, this fire support mech is popular among the more advanced periphery states and with many mercenary commands. Refitting a standard 2A with an XL Engine, Gibson Federated stripped the weapons and replaced them with a pair of LRM-15’s and 3 tons of ammunition. Conceived as a relatively cheap support mech, with the speed to keep up with lighter scout elements and enough ammunition to last most engagements, it has maintained steady sales since it’s introduction and convinced Gibson to refit one of their older 2A production lines; to produce this variant. Deployed by everyone from the FWL to the Outworlds Alliance, this mech has been spreading across the IS and is a common sight among defensive garrisons. Critics of the design note it’s lack of armour and CASE whilst proponents praise it’s low cost and tactical flexibility. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_cicada_CDA-3E.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: A somewhat unusual design, this fire support mech is popular among the more advanced periphery states and with many mercenary commands. Original: The 3F Cicada is one of the most advanced versions of this 'Mech, its upgrades based on combat reports from the front lines of the Clan Invasion, and was introduced in 3052. The chassis has been constructed using Endo Steel construction techniques and the 'Mech is protected with six and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor. The 3F is powered by an extralight engine and carries a weapons loadout that appears to be a cross between the 2A and 3C models. The primary weapon is an ER PPC, which is backed up by two medium lasers. What's more the Cicada can now jump up to two hundred and forty meters thanks to the inclusion of eight jump jets. Restricted Actuators- Left: Upper, Right: Upper
Name: Base_3061.mechdef_cicada_CDA-3F.Details

Localization.CULTURE_EN_US: The 3F Cicada is one of the most advanced versions of this 'Mech, its upgrades based on combat reports from the front lines of the Clan Invasion, and was introduced in 3052.
